sources.title: King of the Damned
sources.description: “Earnest political allegory” “One of the best” “Charismatic Conrad steals the show” (IMDB reviews quotes). A prison drama with political overtones in which Conrad Veidt leads a rebellion against a cruel warden. Good Anglo-Germen-American cast and good production values. Unfortunately they the weren’t enough. Its financial failure was Gaumont's death knell as an independent British production company. IMDB rating 6.2. Walter Forde. Released in 1935. Complete print but with marginal image quality.

metadata.Plot: An educated convict and prisoner leads a group of other inmates in a rebellion against the cruel authority figure of the prison.They try to act before one of their own gets executed.
metadata.Writer: John Chancellor, A.R. Rawlinson, Sidney Gilliat
metadata.Actors: Conrad Veidt, Helen Vinson, Noah Beery
